software.leonov.system.monitor

Interface CpuUsage


  • public interface CpuUsage
    The Central Processing Unit (CPU) usage metrics.
    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getAverageProcessCpuLoad()
      Returns the average JVM process CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported or not ready.
      double getAverageSystemCpuLoad()
      Returns average system-wide CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported or not ready.
      double getMaxProcessCpuLoad()
      Returns the maximum observed JVM process CPU usage (0.0 to 100.0) or -1 if it is not supported or not ready.
      double getMaxSystemCpuLoad()
      Returns the maximum observed system-wide CPU usage (0.0 to 100.0) or -1 if it is not supported or not ready.
      double getProcessCpuLoad()
      Returns the JVM process CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported.
      double getSystemCpuLoad()
      Returns the system-wide CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported.
      double getSystemLoadAverage()
      Returns the system load average for the last minute (only supported on Unix/Linux systems) or -1 if it is not supported.

    • Method Detail

      • getProcessCpuLoad

        double getProcessCpuLoad()
        Returns the JVM process CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported.
        Returns:
        the JVM process CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported

      • getSystemCpuLoad

        double getSystemCpuLoad()
        Returns the system-wide CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported.
        Returns:
        the system-wide CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported

      • getSystemLoadAverage

        double getSystemLoadAverage()
        Returns the system load average for the last minute (only supported on Unix/Linux systems) or -1 if it is not supported.

        For more details see OperatingSystemMXBean.getSystemLoadAverage().

        Returns:
        the system load average for the last minute or -1 if it is not supported

      • getAverageProcessCpuLoad

        double getAverageProcessCpuLoad()
        Returns the average JVM process CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported or not ready.
        Returns:
        the average JVM process CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported or not ready

      • getAverageSystemCpuLoad

        double getAverageSystemCpuLoad()
        Returns average system-wide CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported or not ready.
        Returns:
        average system-wide CPU usage or -1 if it is not supported or not ready

      • getMaxProcessCpuLoad

        double getMaxProcessCpuLoad()
        Returns the maximum observed JVM process CPU usage (0.0 to 100.0) or -1 if it is not supported or not ready.
        Returns:
        the maximum observed JVM process CPU usage (0.0 to 100.0) or -1 if it is not supported or not ready

      • getMaxSystemCpuLoad

        double getMaxSystemCpuLoad()
        Returns the maximum observed system-wide CPU usage (0.0 to 100.0) or -1 if it is not supported or not ready.
        Returns:
